items.title: Western Australia's Payarri people celebrate state's 150th native title determination after 30-year journey
items.summary: It was 1994 when Ngalia man Kado Muir first sat down with two of his elders and a lawyer to discuss lodging a native title claim for his ancestral country, Payarri. Today, the Federal Court will make an on-country determination of that claim.

items.title: Pentagon watchdog finds Hegseth's use of Signal posed risk to US personnel
items.summary: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

items.title: Raccoon goes on drunken rampage in US liquor store

items.title: Multiple charges laid after fatal shooting of man at Logan, south of Brisbane

items.title: Large gorilla sculpture installed in Batemans Bay park divides opinion
items.summary: A statue of a 30-year-old eastern lowland gorilla named Mina is one of 22 donated to Eurobodalla Shire Council by internationally recognised artists Gillie and Marc.

items.title: Singapore-based firm scraps Darwin hotel project after sacred site fight
items.summary: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.

items.title: Three deaths related to asbestos exposure at former ABC site
items.summary: Staff at the former ABC studios in Elsternwick were exposed to asbestos over an extended period.

items.title: Review into incident at Tasmania's Ashley Youth Detention Centre of makeshift spit hood on detainee's head tabled in parliament
items.summary: An incident at a Tasmanian youth detention centre where a detainee had an improvised spit hood put over his head while being transported by a contracted security company, has been criticised for being "entirely incompatible" with human rights.

items.title: Ex-AFL agent Ricky Nixon found guilty of selling fake football memorabilia
items.summary: After facing AFL premiership players in court, a former player agent is fined $4,500 for selling fraudulent memorabilia from the 2021 grand final.

items.title: Ravensthorpe deputy shire president Mark Mudie killed in West River fire
items.summary: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south is identified as the local town's deputy shire president.

items.title: Usman Khawaja ruled out of Brisbane Test following back injury, Travis Head set to open
items.summary: Australia will be without veteran opener Usman Khawaja for the second Ashes Test after the 38-year old was ruled out due to an ongoing back problem.

items.title: England trio Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith spotted riding e-scooters without helmets in Brisbane
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes and several teammates have been spotted in Brisbane riding e-scooters without helmets ahead of the second Ashes Test.

items.title: Queensland man Brett Daniel Taylor charged with assisted suicides of three people granted bail
items.summary: A Queensland man charged with assisting the suicides of three people has successfully applied for bail.

items.title: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne breached parliamentarians' code of conduct with anonymous text criticising Elizabeth Lee
items.summary: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne is found to have breached the code of conduct for a parliamentarian over an anonymous text message she sent criticising former Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee.

items.title: Parkway Drive's Park Waves festival cancelled ahead of 2026 Australian debut
items.summary: Park Waves festival, set for February 2026, has been cancelled amid economic challenges, joining a growing list of scrapped Australian music events.

items.title: Optus reveals nearly half a million phones may be unable to dial Triple Zero
items.summary: The figure has been provided to a Senate estimates hearing, where the media regulator appeared on Tuesday.

items.title: Rise in threats by sovereign citizens sparks call for Victorian judges to receive security allowance
items.summary: A report tabled in state parliament has recommended judicial officers be paid an allowance to increase their personal security.

items.title: New images show Chinese flotilla with formidable firepower in Philippine Sea
items.summary: Private firm Starboard Maritime Intelligence says it has used satellite technology to track down the People's Liberation Army Navy task group.

items.title: 'Gun fanatic' ex-police officer to stand trial in Victoria over weapons cache
items.summary: A former police officer is set to face trial after investigators allegedly uncovered a large cache of weapons, firearm parts and chemicals on his property.

items.title: Bunbury man jailed three-and-a-half years for filming people using public toilets in WA
items.summary: A 42-year-old Bunbury man has been sentenced to three years and six months jail for filming people, including children, using public bathrooms across Western Australia.

items.title: Echuca man Jake Cartledge jailed over 'horrific' crash that killed girlfriend and younger brother
items.summary: A young driver who attempted a "power skid" before slamming into a tree has been sentenced over the deaths of his girlfriend and younger brother.

items.title: Canberra man jailed over violent road rage incidents, fined for performing Nazi salute outside synagogue
items.summary: A Canberra man has been jailed over a string of road rage attacks committed "for trivial reasons", and fined $10,000 for performing a Nazi salute outside a Queensland synagogue.

items.title: Neighbour called abuse line to report mother accused of daughter's neglect, court hears
items.summary: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.

items.title: Concerns still remain as Northern Water names site for $5bn desal plant
items.summary: The long-awaited decision for a Northern Water project has arrived — but it has come with environmental contention.

items.title: Man accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley wanted to be 'needle in a haystack' in India, court hears
items.summary: Former nurse Rajwinder Singh has pleaded not guilty to the murder of 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley in Far North Queensland in October 2018.

items.title: Pilliga murder trial hinges on mental state of man who killed his father
items.summary: The mental state of a man who has admitted to killing his father at Pilliga in north-west New South Wales will be key to the outcome of his murder trial.

items.title: Australian National University abandons plan to axe the School of Music after public pressure
items.summary: The Australian National University has abandoned a controversial plan to absorb its School of Music into a single course after extraordinary public pressure.

items.title: Where US and Venezuelan alliances lie as tensions escalate in the Caribbean
items.summary: As the United States mounts pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, nations in the Caribbean, South America and across the world are revealing where their support lies.

items.title: My daughter has two mums. I'm her other mother
items.summary: Even though I am Evie's favourite — I am, after all, the fun mum — I can't shake the feeling that when it comes to serious mothering, I'm the spare. Her back-up mum.

items.title: Musicians from small organisations lead the charge to platform people with disability
items.summary: Going to a concert can be hard for people with disability. But sensory concerts and bringing lived experience on stage can open up this world for everyone.

items.title: Fugitive prisoner who evaded police for months charged after dramatic Alice Springs arrest
items.summary: An absconded prisoner has been charged with 15 offences, including strangulation and making threats to kill, after escaping police custody and evading capture for more than 70 days.

items.title: Beekeepers warn of food price increases amid varroa mite battle in South Australia
items.summary: Beekeepers say the escalating cost of pollinating crops will be passed onto consumers as the industry battles a devastating bee killer.

items.title: Spear fisher accused of killing protected blue groper on NSW Central Coast
items.summary: Investigations are underway into the death of the near-threatened species on the NSW Central Coast, prompting calls for better awareness about local marine life.

items.title: Elderly woman allegedly assaulted in 'unprovoked and isolated' incident at South Plympton
items.summary: Police say members of the public helped the 84-year-old woman after the alleged attack before she was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

items.title: New details of ADF sexual violence probe revealed
items.summary: Minister Matt Keogh is addressing the National Press Club a year after the government responded to the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.

items.title: Victoria's first summer Japanese encephalitis virus detection at Horsham in state's west
items.summary: The first detection of Japanese encephalitis virus for the summer has been made in a rural Victorian city.

items.title: Papua New Guinea calls for 'buffer zone' with Indonesia amid concerns over West Papua conflict
items.summary: Australia, Papua New Guinea and Indonesia have started holding annual defence ministers meetings to build trust and boost military cooperation, while PNG proposes building a 10km-wide demilitarised "buffer zone" along its border with Indonesia.

items.title: E-bike rider killed in collision with garbage truck in Sydney CBD as NSW premier announces new legislation
items.summary: The rider, a man aged in his 30s, was treated by paramedics but could not be saved.

items.title: Perth Bears sign halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for 2027 NRL season
items.summary: The NRL's Perth expansion team secures the signature of former Bulldogs halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for their inaugural season in 2027.

items.title: Experts unsure why sea snake deaths are increasing at Shark Bay World Heritage site
items.summary: Locals and marine life experts raise concern over an increased amount of reptiles washing up on WA's north-west shores, with reports of stranded sea snakes and turtles being spotted on beaches.

items.title: Right to repair reforms to be expanded to farm machinery
items.summary: After years of depending on dealership networks for essential repairs, farmers will have the right to fix their own equipment.

items.title: Man charged with murder after Far North Queensland stabbing
items.summary: A 63-year-old man charged with murder (domestic violence) is due to face Cairns Magistrates Court on Wednesday.

items.title: Farmer killed fighting West River bushfire near Ravensthorpe on WA's south coast
items.summary: A man is killed while trying to establish a firebreak to help tackle a blaze near Ravensthorpe along WA's south coast, with the premier describing his death as "devastating".

items.title: South Coast fishermen charged over alleged deliberate scuttling of trawler
items.summary: Two Ulladulla fishermen have been charged under federal sea-dumping laws over the alleged deliberate sinking of an unseaworthy trawler.

items.title: Western Bulldogs former number one AFLW pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner wants to join North Melbourne
items.summary: The Kangaroos' domination of the AFLW is set to be given another boost, with a former number one draft pick confirming she wants to head to North.

items.title: Submarine tour, roof protest and shark encounter feature in our top WA photos for November
items.summary: Our photographers cast their eyes towards WA's exploding rabbit population, a surfer's near-miss with a suspected great white shark, and a school program helping parents bond with their children.

items.title: Statistically, it's impossible to predict domestic violence homicide. That doesn't mean we should give up
items.summary: Victims must always be believed. The uncomfortable truth, however, is that statistically, it is almost impossible to predict lethal family violence because it is so rare.

items.title: How Wiradjuri constellations like the Great Celestial Emu make us look at the sky in a different way
items.summary: All 88 internationally recognised constellations have European origins. But First Nations astronomy tells older, beautiful stories that contain invaluable lessons and knowledge.

items.title: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro calls out Australian football's 'inferiority complex' in passionate plea
items.summary: Joe Montemurro echoes the words of former Matildas boss Alen Stajcic in offering a frank review of the culture surrounding the world game in Australia.

items.title: Allegations of sexual misconduct levelled at father-son Bowen therapists in Ballarat
items.summary: Five women allege sexual misconduct against a Ballarat Bowen therapy business run by a father-son duo.

items.title: Scathing 'jobs for mates' review finds government appointments too often look like 'nepotism'
items.summary: A report into government appointments to boards savages the system, which it says too often allows governments to award friends or pick candidates for political purposes, eroding trust with the public.

items.title: ASX edges higher, Bitcoin dives, government releases its National AI Plan - as it happened
items.summary: The ASX edged higher, while the federal government released its National AI Plan. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: South Australian farmers fear future as bird flu recovery causes egg oversupply
items.summary: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

items.title: White House says Hegseth authorised admiral to strike alleged drug boat
items.summary: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth authorised an admiral to conduct multiple strikes that killed 11 people on a vessel from Venezuela allegedly carrying illegal narcotics in September.

items.title: Filmmaker breaks decades of silence over Yolŋu clan leader's alleged murder by police
items.summary: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

items.title: Andrew Lethlean undecided on whether to challenge Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East
items.summary: Nationals favourite Andrew Lethlean is tight-lipped on whether he will challenge Premier Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East next year.

items.title: Federal politics: Defence sexual violence convictions to be recorded on national database — as it happened
items.summary: The veterans' affairs minister says Defence personnel who commit sexual violence will have their convictions recorded on their national criminal history check.

items.title: As teacher shortages loom across Australia these Queensland schools are trialling solutions
items.summary: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

items.title: Secret government audit reveals how big travel companies can overcharge clients
items.summary: The document, prepared for the Queensland government, has been exclusively obtained by the ABC.

items.title: Uber driver says rideshare app tells workers to flout road rules as bill introduced
items.summary: The NSW government introduces legislation that would require employers to ensure their algorithms and automation practises do not risk a worker's health and safety.

items.title: Two teenage boys charged over fire at Deniliquin High School
items.summary: Two teenage boys have been charged over a weekend fire that extensively damaged Deniliquin High School in the NSW Riverina.

items.title: Why you should read the fine print when purchasing a gift card this festive season
items.summary: If you receive a gift card for Christmas this year you might fall foul of "activation rules". Here's how.

items.title: Artificial intelligence to be managed through existing laws under National AI Plan
items.summary: The federal government's long-awaited National AI Plan will seek to accelerate the growth of artificial intelligence in Australia, and largely leverage existing laws to protect against its worst harms.

items.title: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success
items.summary: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

items.title: NDIS cuts Deaf man's Auslan funding, recommends he explore 'other communication methods'
items.summary: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

items.title: Tumbling Bitcoin's last useful business — money laundering — under threat from Tether
items.summary: It remains a useful tool for some nefarious operators, including global crime gangs and questionable governments, but Bitcoin's role has been usurped by stablecoins — one in particular.

items.title: Is social media masking bushwalking dangers and leading to poor hiking decisions?
items.summary: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

items.title: Woolworths accused of exploiting affordable housing schemes to push new developments
items.summary: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.
